member.name: IMFAudioStreamVolume.GetAllVolumes
member.summary: Retrieves the volume levels for all of the channels in the audio stream.
member.param: Number of elements in the pfVolumes array. The value must equal the number of channels. To get the number of channels, call .
Address of an array of size dwCount, allocated by the caller. The method fills the array with the volume level for each channel in the stream.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFAudioStreamVolume.GetChannelCount
member.summary: Retrieves the number of channels in the audio stream.
member.param: Receives the number of channels in the audio stream.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFAudioStreamVolume.GetChannelVolume
member.summary: Retrieves the volume level for a specified channel in the audio stream.
member.param: Zero-based index of the audio channel. To get the number of channels, call .
Receives the volume level for the channel.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFAudioStreamVolume.SetAllVolumes
member.summary: Sets the individual volume levels for all of the channels in the audio stream.
member.param: Number of elements in the pfVolumes array. The value must equal the number of channels. To get the number of channels, call .

Address of an array of size dwCount, allocated by the caller. The array specifies the volume levels for all of the channels. Before calling the method, set each element of the array to the desired volume level for the channel.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFAudioStreamVolume.SetChannelVolume
member.summary: Sets the volume level for a specified channel in the audio stream.
member.param: Zero-based index of the audio channel. To get the number of channels, call .

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.para: Controls the volume levels of individual audio channels.

The streaming audio renderer (SAR) exposes this interface as a service. To get a pointer to the interface, call with the service identifier MR_STREAM_VOLUME_SERVICE. You can call GetService directly on the SAR or call it on the Media Session.
